intro: Betonica algeriensis, commonly known as Algerian betony, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, sunny habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly woolly texture, while its flowers are arranged in spikes. Betonica algeriensis is valued for its medicinal properties and is sometimes used in traditional herbal remedies.
